abstract: For less than $26 a month, a scrappy Hong Kong company is offering 1,000-megabit-a-second broadband service — an unheard-of speed across much of America.
snippet: For less than $26 a month, a scrappy Hong Kong company is offering 1,000-megabit-a-second broadband service — an unheard-of speed across much of America.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG residents can enjoy astoundingly fast broadband at an astoundingly low price. It became available last year, when a scrappy company called  Hong Kong Broadband Network introduced a new option for its fiber-to-the-home service: a speed of 1,000 megabits a second — known as a “gig” — for less than $26 a month.

headline.main: Cheap, Ultrafast Broadband? Hong Kong Has It
headline.print_headline: Cheap, Ultrafast Broadband? At Least Hong Kong Has It
